intro: Tarenna mossambicensis, commonly known as the Madagascar tarenna, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small shrub native to Madagascar, characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
